title: Visit to Peter Nygard’s Toronto Office Ended in Rape, Woman Testifies
description: The woman told a Toronto jury that Peter Nygard sexually assaulted her when she was 28, and she was the first of five accusers to appear in court in what is expected to be a seven-week trial.

title: Russian Troops Cede Ground and Strike Back
description: Military analysts say that Russian commanders have been using a tactic known as “elastic defense” to prevent Ukraine from holding villages and other positions as staging grounds for future attacks.

title: U.S. and World Leaders Pledge Support for Ukraine ‘for as Long as It Takes’
description: President Biden, in a conference call with world leaders amid tumult in Congress, insisted that U.S. aid would not be interrupted.

title: Catholic Conservatives Criticize Pope Francis’ Synod
description: As bishops and laypeople from around the world prepared to gather at the Vatican, traditionalist Catholics who would not be among them staged their own show.

title: Wednesday Briefing: McCarthy Ousted as House Speaker
description: Plus wind-powered merchant ships to fight climate change.

title: Piecing Together Stories of Migrants Who Were Killed in the Greece Wildfires
description: A Times reporter hiked to a rugged region in Greece where the bodies of 18 asylum seekers were found. She returned, weeks later, with a man who had lost his brother.

title: Greenland Indigenous Women Demand Compensation for Involuntary IUDs
description: A group of Indigenous women in Greenland say Danish doctors inserted intrauterine devices without their consent. They are now seeking damages from the Danish government.

title: India Moves to Expel Canadian Diplomats
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada said that his country is in talks with India to avert the expulsions.

title: Athens Democracy Forum: Daring to Hope That Democracy Will Prevail
description: Democracies have to adjust to a changed world, but the challenge before them is to do so without losing their essential values.

title: At the Athens Democracy Forum, Climate, Technology, Ukraine and Youth Dominated
description: Speakers warned that threats from climate change, cyberattacks and Russia’s aggression were undermining democracy.

title: Athens Democracy Forum: Are Artificial Intelligence and Democracy Compatible?
description: Nick Clegg of Meta says that they can be, with the right systems in place.

title: Athens Democracy Forum: Local Forces Are Leading the Way in the Global Warming Crisis
description: With central democratic institutions falling short on climate solutions, grassroots efforts are filling some of the gaps. But would autocracies do a better job?

title: Athens Democracy Forum: Rethinking Security When So Many Threats Are Invisible
description: One U.S. company is helping Ukraine behind the scenes combat not only attacks from traditional weapons but invisible ones, too.

title: Athens Democracy Forum: The Disunited States of South America
description: It’s about to become an economic powerhouse, but there has been no successful attempt to unify the region.

title: Senate Delegation to Travel to China During Congressional Recess
description: The trip comes at a time of heightened tensions between Beijing and Washington, as the Biden administration restricts investments in key Chinese sectors while trying to improve relations.

title: Athens Democracy Forum: Across Africa, Young Leaders Emerge
description: Six people, all 35 or younger, talk about what they are doing to shake up politics on the continent, and what inspired them to step up.

title: Athens Democracy Forum: China and the U.S. Are Intertwined, but Share a Distrust
description: It’s the intensifying rivalry that could shape much of the world’s future.

title: Athens Democracy Forum: Africa Looks Ahead With Hope
description: Despite its problems, the continent is showing positive signs for democracy. Will that lead to a new future for its 1.2 billion citizens?

title: Barcelona’s Sagrada Familia Inches Closer to Being Done
description: After 140 years, Antoni Gaudí’s unrealized masterpiece is finally nearing completion. But hurdles still remain, with construction to last until at least 2026.

title: New Delhi Police Raid Journalists in India
description: The sweep caught up contributors to a left-leaning news website, according to other news outlets and those raided. A Times investigation had linked the site to a pro-China network.

title: Russian Ruble Briefly Weakens to 100 Against U.S. Dollar
description: The currency has been significantly weaker since the start of the year, in a sign of the financial volatility prompted by the war in Ukraine.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Latest News: Russian Defensive Tactic Helps Slow Ukrainian Advance
description: By ceding ground before striking back, Moscow’s forces are using a longstanding method to impede Ukraine’s counteroffensive, analysts say.

title: Typhoon Koinu: Taiwan Prepares for Rain and Wind Ahead of Landfall
description: Weather officials in Taiwan on Tuesday declared a land warning and a strong wind notice for multiple cities.

title: Sunak’s UK Conservative Party Conference Haunted by Truss and Other Rivals
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak hopes his governing party’s annual conference can lift his ailing poll numbers. Predecessors and would-be successors have other priorities.

title: A Rural Michigan Town Is the Latest Battleground in the U.S.-China Fight
description: Firestorms over Chinese investments, like a battery factory in Green Charter Township, are erupting as officials weigh the risks of taking money from an adversary.

title: Tuesday Briefing
description: Donald Trump’s fraud trial.

title: Israeli Herders Spread Across West Bank, Displacing Palestinians
description: Palestinian herding communities are abandoning their villages, ceding huge swaths of land to nearby Israeli settlers. Settler activists say it’s the result of their new strategy in the West Bank.

title: Town’s Revolt Reveals Larger German Concerns About Arming Ukraine
description: The resistance of tiny Grossenhain to a new arms plant shows how the government’s plan for a more assertive foreign policy is struggling to gain traction.

title: With Surge in Attacks, Militants Begin New Era of Bloodshed in Pakistan
description: For nearly a decade, the country had seemingly broken the cycle of violence, but extremist groups have bounced back since the Taliban regained control in neighboring Afghanistan.
